title: After the First Mission
description: Chrysostom's response when you return from helping the widow

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: You returned. Tell me—how is Maria? How are her children?

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: They ate. The youngest cried when he saw the bread. He thought it was a dream.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: (His eyes glisten. He turns away for a moment.)

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: That child's tears—they are worth more than all the gold in the imperial treasury.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: Do you know what you did today, {playerName}? You became the hands of Christ.

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: I carried bread. Anyone could have done it.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: Yes. Anyone could have. And yet, most do not.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: The Empress has servants who could feed a thousand widows. She does not send them.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: The senators have wealth that could empty every beggar's bowl in Constantinople. Their gold stays in their coffers.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: But you—a thief, a stranger, someone with nothing—you carried bread.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: This is the scandal of the Gospel. The last shall be first.

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: You speak as if I did something great. I was hungry. You promised me food.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: And was the bread good?

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: ...Yes. It was good.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: But I think something else was better. When that child wept—what did you feel?

lines.speaker: You
lines.text: (You are silent. You don't have words for it.)

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: That feeling—that is the beginning of everything.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: The philosophers call it compassion. We call it love. But it is more than a word.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: It is the image of God in you, waking up.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: Now. There is more work to be done, if you are willing.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: The market quarter is full of merchants who cheat the poor. They use false weights, they hoard grain to drive up prices.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: I cannot go there myself—when I preach against the rich, they smile and wait for me to leave.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: But you... you could watch. Listen. Tell me what you see.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: There is a merchant named Kyriakos who sells grain near the eastern stalls. I have heard troubling things.

lines.speaker: Chrysostom
lines.text: Go. See for yourself. Come back and tell me the truth.

lines.speaker: System
lines.text: ✦ Quest Started: The False Measure ✦

lines.speaker: System
lines.text: Investigate the merchant Kyriakos in the market quarter.
